intro.description: It's possible to display the rings from various calibrants using the tools in the MX image viewer. Before you being, go to the Project Explorer and double-click to open e.g. the image 'data/examples/ref-testscale_1_001.img'.

item.title: Calibrant
item.description: Choosing the calibrant There are a number of pre-entered calibrants in the preferences associated with the diffraction viewer. These are Cr2O3, Silicon and Bee's wax.

subitem.label: These can be found by opening the preferences window by 'Window' -> 'Preferences' from the menu. Search for 'Diffraction Viewer' to bring up the correct set of preferences. Then click on the Calibration tab.
To add a custom calibrant enter the name and the d spacing separated by commas and press add. Once the new calibrant is added, select it from the list and click OK.

item.title: Showing the Calibrant
item.description: The calibrant rings can be seen by clicking the 'Resolution rings' drop-down in the toolbar just above the image. It is also useful to show the beam centre.
